intro: Belmontia stricta, commonly known as the slender belmontia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Arecaceae family, commonly known as the palm family, and is characterized by its slender, upright growth habit. The plant features a single, unbranched stem that can reach heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are long, pinnately compound, and often have a waxy texture. Belmontia stricta produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color, which eventually develop into edible fruits.
